common_style: Minimalist 3D isometric illustration, diagnostic style, transparent background, square aspect ratio, no text, no extra objects

tasks.prompt: Houseplant leaf with various spots and discolorations.
Drooping, wilting houseplant with dry, crispy leaves.
Houseplant leaf covered in white powdery mildew and fuzzy mold.
Houseplant leaf with small insects, spider webs, and sticky droplets.
Houseplant leaf that is twisted, curled, and abnormally shaped.
Close-up of a houseplant leaf with distinct brown and yellow spots.
Houseplant leaf turning completely yellow while veins stay slightly green.
Houseplant with soft, limp cloth-like leaves hanging down.
Houseplant leaf with brown, crispy, burnt edges.
White powdery mildew on a leaf, looking like flour or dust.
Gray, fuzzy mold (Botrytis) on a leaf or stem, looks like soft gray fur.
Yellow spots on the upper side of a leaf and purplish-gray fuzzy coating on the underside.
Glossy, sticky transparent film (honeydew) on a leaf surface.
Distinct dry, crispy brown spots on a leaf.
Water-soaked, soft, and dark spots on a leaf.
Pale, bleached, or beige dry spots on a leaf, appearing on the side facing light.
Dark brown irregular spots, clearly not related to light exposure.
Dark brown spots with concentric circles, clearly spreading across the leaf.
Small, static spots that do not seem to grow.
Small orange or rusty-colored bumps (pustules) on the underside of a leaf.
Mushy, decaying leaf tissue with a dark, slimy appearance.
Watery spots on a leaf that are not decaying or smelly.
Dark spots on a leaf surrounded by a distinct bright yellow ring (halo).
Only the oldest, bottom leaves of a plant are turning yellow.
Only the newest, top leaves are turning yellow (chlorosis).
The entire plant is becoming pale yellow.
Small, pale leaves and stunted, weak plant growth.
Yellow leaf with distinct, bright green veins (interveinal chlorosis).
Dark, wet, muddy soil in a pot.
Light-colored, cracked, and dry soil in a pot.
Perfectly moist, dark brown crumbly soil.
A plant looking shocked, with sudden drooping or dark patches after a cold draft.
Leaf with only the very tips being brown and crispy.
Leaf with brown, crispy edges along the entire perimeter.
Air around the plant looking dry, symbolized by a small radiator icon nearby.
White crusty mineral buildup on the soil surface or pot rim.
Tiny white dots on a leaf and a very fine spider web.
Clusters of small green or black insects on a young shoot.
White, cotton-like fluffy bugs in the leaf axils.
Small brown, oval, shell-like bumps firmly attached to a stem.
Silvery streaks and tiny black specks (excrement) on a leaf.
Tiny white moths flying around a plant.
Leaf with a mottled, "mosaic" pattern of light and dark green patches.
A plant with long, thin, weak stems and small leaves (etiolation).
